sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An Exact description of a Roundhead, and a long-head shag-poll: taken our [sic] of the purest antiquities and records. Wherein are confuted the odious aspersions of malignant spirits: especially in answer to those most rediculous, absurd and beyond comparison, most foolish baffle-headed pamphlets sent into the world by a sinking locust, viz. The devill turn'd Round-head. The resolution of the Round-head. [double brace] The vindication of the Round-head. and Jourdan the players ex-exercising [sic]. Taylor, John, 1580-1653,
8 p.
Printed for George Tomlinson, and are to sold [sic] in the Ould-Baily., London, : 1642.
Sometimes attributed to John Taylor. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
An Exact description of a Roundhead, and a long-head shag-poll: taken our [sic] of the purest antiquities and records. Wherein are confuted the odious aspersions of malignant spirits: especially in answer to those most rediculous, absurd and beyond comparison, most foolish baffle-headed pamphlets sent into the world by a sinking locust, viz. The devill turn'd Round-head. The resolution of the Round-head. [double brace] The vindication of the Round-head. and Jourdan the players ex-exercising [sic]. Taylor, John, 1580-1653,
8 p.
Printed for George Tomlinson, and are to sold [sic] in the Ould-Baily., London, : 1642.
Sometimes attributed to John Taylor. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
George Tomlinson
the Ould-Baily.
